tool.name: qiime2 longitudinal linear-mixed-effects

param.name: state_column
param.label: state_column: Str
param.help: [required] Metadata column containing state (time) variable information.
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

param.name: individual_id_column
param.label: individual_id_column: Str
param.help: [required] Metadata column containing IDs for individual subjects.
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

conditional.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__conditional__metric__
conditional.label: metric: Str
conditional.help: [optional] Dependent variable column name. Must be a column name located in the metadata or feature table files.

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: metric: Str
param.help: [optional] Dependent variable column name. Must be a column name located in the metadata or feature table files.

conditional.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__conditional__group_columns__
conditional.label: group_columns: Str
conditional.help: [optional] Comma-separated list (without spaces) of metadata columns to use as independent covariates used to determine mean structure of "metric".

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: group_columns: Str
param.help: [optional] Comma-separated list (without spaces) of metadata columns to use as independent covariates used to determine mean structure of "metric".

conditional.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__conditional__random_effects__
conditional.label: random_effects: Str
conditional.help: [optional] Comma-separated list (without spaces) of metadata columns to use as independent covariates used to determine the variance and covariance structure (random effects) of "metric". To add a random slope, the same value passed to "state_column" should be passed here. A random intercept for each individual is set by default and does not need to be passed here.

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: random_effects: Str
param.help: [optional] Comma-separated list (without spaces) of metadata columns to use as independent covariates used to determine the variance and covariance structure (random effects) of "metric". To add a random slope, the same value passed to "state_column" should be passed here. A random intercept for each individual is set by default and does not need to be passed here.

param.name: palette
param.label: palette: Str % Choices('Set1', 'Set2', 'Set3', 'Pastel1', 'Pastel2', 'Paired', 'Accent', 'Dark2', 'tab10', 'tab20', 'tab20b', 'tab20c', 'viridis', 'plasma', 'inferno', 'magma', 'terrain', 'rainbow', 'cividis')
param.help: [default: 'Set1'] Color palette to use for generating boxplots.

param.name: lowess
param.label: lowess: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Estimate locally weighted scatterplot smoothing. Note that this will eliminate confidence interval plotting.

param.name: ci
param.label: ci: Float % Range(0, 100)
param.help: [default: 95] Size of the confidence interval for the regression estimate.

conditional.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__conditional__formula__
conditional.label: formula: Str
conditional.help: [optional] R-style formula to use for model specification. A formula must be used if the "metric" parameter is None. Note that the metric and group columns specified in the formula will override metric and group columns that are passed separately as parameters to this method. Formulae will be in the format "a ~ b + c", where "a" is the metric (dependent variable) and "b" and "c" are independent covariates. Use "+" to add a variable; "+ a:b" to add an interaction between variables a and b; "*" to include a variable and all interactions; and "-" to subtract a particular term (e.g., an interaction term). See https://patsy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/formulas.html for full documentation of valid formula operators. Always enclose formulae in quotes to avoid unpleasant surprises.

param.name: __q2galaxy__GUI__select__
param.label: formula: Str
param.help: [optional] R-style formula to use for model specification. A formula must be used if the "metric" parameter is None. Note that the metric and group columns specified in the formula will override metric and group columns that are passed separately as parameters to this method. Formulae will be in the format "a ~ b + c", where "a" is the metric (dependent variable) and "b" and "c" are independent covariates. Use "+" to add a variable; "+ a:b" to add an interaction between variables a and b; "*" to include a variable and all interactions; and "-" to subtract a particular term (e.g., an interaction term). See https://patsy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/formulas.html for full documentation of valid formula operators. Always enclose formulae in quotes to avoid unpleasant surprises.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: longitudinal linear-mixed-effects ========================================== Linear mixed effects modeling
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Linear mixed effects models evaluate the contribution of exogenous covariates "group_columns" and "random_effects" to a single dependent variable, "metric". Perform LME and plot line plots of each group column. A feature table artifact is required input, though whether "metric" is derived from the feature table or metadata is optional.
|
